title: Ticket #1007: cluster optimization (ad chaining) corrupts job ad semantics
description:
The way ad chaining is used during submission is the first job (first queue) in the submit file becomes the cluster and all other jobs are diffs against it. This means attributes only present in the first ad will appear in all others. For instance, 

$ condor_version
$CondorVersion: 7.4.0 Nov  1 2009 BuildID: 193173 $
$CondorPlatform: I386-LINUX_RHEL5 $

$ echo "executable = /bin/sleep\narguments = 150\nhold = true\nqueue\nhold = false\nqueue\n" | condor_submitSubmitting job(s)..
2 job(s) submitted to cluster 338.

$ condor_q

-- Submitter: chopin.cs.wisc.edu : <128.105.121.21:40246> : chopin.cs.wisc.edu
 ID      OWNER            SUBMITTED     RUN_TIME ST PRI SIZE CMD
 338.0   matt           11/30 11:05   0+00:00:00 H  0   97.7 sleep 150
 338.1   matt           11/30 11:05   0+00:00:00 I  0   97.7 sleep 150

2 jobs; 1 idle, 0 running, 1 held

$ condor_q -l 338.1 | grep Hold
NumSystemHolds = 0
HoldReason = "submitted on hold at user's request"
HoldReasonCode = 15
PeriodicHold = FALSE
OnExitHold = FALSE
creator: matt
